title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 12, ch. XI, subch. A, pt. 801 - Recording And Reporting Public Employees' Occupational Injuries And Illnesses
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 12, ch. XI, subch. A, pt. 801 - Recording And Reporting Public Employees' Occupational Injuries And Illnesses

State Regulations
§ 801.0 - Purpose
§ 801.1 to 801.3 - Repealed
§ 801.4 - Recording criteria
§ 801.5 - Determination of work-relatedness
§ 801.6 - Determination of new cases
§ 801.7 - General recording criteria
§ 801.8 - Recording criteria for needlesticks and sharps injuries
§ 801.9 - Recording criteria for cases involving medical removal under pesh standards
§ 801.10 - Recording criteria for cases involving occupational hearing loss
§ 801.11 - Recording criteria for work-related tuberculosis cases
§ 801.12 - Repealed
§ 801.29 - Forms
§ 801.30 - Multiple establishments
§ 801.31 - Covered employees
§ 801.32 - Annual summary
§ 801.33 - Retention and updating
§ 801.35 - Employee involvement
§ 801.39 - Reporting fatalities, hospitalizations, amputations, and losses of an eye as a result of work-related incidents
§ 801.40 - Providing records to government representatives
§ 801.41 - Electronic submission of Employer Identification Number (EIN) and injury and illness records
§ 801.42 - Requests from the bureau of labor statistics for data
§ 801.44 - Retention and updating of old forms
§ 801.46 - Definitions
§ 801.47 - Posters for public employees

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 12, ch. XI, subch. A, pt. 801

Statutory authority: Labor Law, §27-a

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
